Key Match Events: Walker Buehler closed out the World Series with a scoreless frame
Freddie Freeman homered in the first four games and provided a crucial, two-run single as the Dodgers erased a five-run deficit in the fifth inning
Gerrit Cole capsized as his defense crumbled around him and made three fielding glitches. All five runs were unearned
Post-Match Reflections: David Roberts expressed that the title was earned without an asterisk
Freddie Freeman was named World Series MVP
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers won their second World Series of the franchise’s new ‘golden era'
The Dodgers' championship validated a $1.4 billion offseason splurge built around Shohei Ohtani and Yoshinobu Yamamoto
The victory ended a 20-year championship drought for the Dodgers
Others: The game did not go as the Dodgers designed it
Callie Treinen recorded seven outs in the eighth inning
Blake Treinen recorded eight outs in the eighth inning
The Dodgers' comeback only set the stage for the excruciating conclusion
